text: I think trying to get to the NBA or
trying to do anything that is
extraordinary and also very improbable
uh just by statistics uh when you when
you look at something like that you have
to have a crystal clear picture of what
you're trying to achieve but more than
that you have to have I think a really
uh pragmatic assessment of who you are
at the beginning one of the things about
goal setting that makes me a little
crazy is that people always think it's
about
looking into the future looking two 5 10
years into the future and knowing that's
where you're going to
get and then they just set off without
any clue about where they are right now
and you know just in terms of simple
cartography you you can't get anywhere
if you don't know where you are now so
for me when I started off it was a
question of looking at myself and saying
yes I'm fat I'm a fat 17-year-old in
England I'm a nerd I like to sit in the
library I don't like to
sweat and yet at the same time I've been
captivated by the idea of being on a
basketball court and being surrounded by
people who made me look a little bit
less like a freak um and so in order to
get to the NBA this ultimate point I'd
watched Larry Bird and Magic Johnson at
the time playing and I was like that's
where I want to be so from then knowing
who I was I put steps in place knowing
that I'd have to get in shape knowing
I'd have to stay motivated knowing that
I'd probably have to leave home in order
to become a basketball player of any
note um so I set up a plan that that had
all these different stages in but also
allowed me flexibility um because the
thing about plans is that they tend to
go wrong at certain stages you tend to
let yourself down environmental factors
step in and mean that you aren't where
you thought you would be at a certain
point and great plans allow flexibility
they allow you to revise your position
and yet still stay on the
ladder I think the more unlikely the
goal that you are trying to achieve the
more logistically sound a plan has to be
um it is one thing to want to be a you
know senior manager of a department shop
somewhere uh not that that in this
economy is particularly easy but it's
certainly more probable than many other
types of job and so to get that way
perhaps you don't need to identify every
single type of shop and what their
particular needs might be and what each
of these shots might be looking for in a
person but in order to play in the NBA
you need to know exactly what the NBA is
looking for you need to know how close
to that you can get you need to know you
know for me there were simple things
like I knew the NBA was looking for
athletes and and I knew I wasn't one so
I also knew that I didn't really like to
sweat and work hard so I had to find a
trainer who I could respond to and you I
had to know my personality types so I
didn't find someone who was a screamer I
found someone who um showed his
disappointment if I wasn't working hard
and I found that was the way to motivate
me um I knew I was kind of lazy so I
built my house you know 500 MERS away
from where my trainer uh trained
athletes so there was never an excuse I
could just fall out of bed and be there
ready to go every day knowing yourself
knowing where you want to get combining
those things gives you the pr Matic
steps
